item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 29th June
item.description:
This taxed vehicle in Marlings Park Avenue, has been here for over 3 months. It has now had damage to the drivers wing mirror hit by passing traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Marlings Park Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Accumulating rubbish, 29th June
item.description:
There seems to be a enhancing amount of rubbish accumulating e.g. furniture, bin, wood, boxes at the rear of properties preventing getting our cars in driveways. Seems to be more each night Peabody vans have looked, seen them even take photos and drove on, me and my partner are fed up with this as it is not the first time and it just seems to be getting worse. If not removed we are going to take matters in our own hands and drag it to main road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of fly tipping in alleyway, 29th June
item.description:
My partner and I are property hunting and viewed a house on this road. In the alleyway, we found a large amount of fly tipping. It looks like it's either from the owner of 8 High St or other people are dumping this crap in his/her parking space. It's a terrible shame because we loved the property. Yet this fly tipping is an eyesore and a blight on the community. It's also a serious health hazard. There's a broken toilet and discarded nappies there! God know what else has been dumped there. There's also two large purple recycling bins round the back that look like they haven't been emptied for months. They're absolutely full to the brim. We noticed these issues on 21st June and they were still here on 28th. It's likely it's been going on for far longer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Black Horse Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
